text: Whether you're Apple TV+ curious or looking to return after a lapsed subscription, you can now get three months of Apple TV+ for $2.99 a month. Here's how to find out if you qualify, and how to get the deal. On Tuesday, Apple TV+ announced that it will be offering a promotional deal for new and qualifying returning subscribers. Now you can pay just $2.99 per month for three months to access the catalog of Apple Original series and films. It's perfect for those who want to get in on the "Severance" hype, as the series is having a bit of a moment right now. A month after "Severance" aired its second season premiere, it toppled "Ted Lasso" as the most watched Apple TV+ series. Of course, there are plenty of other things to watch on Apple TV+, too. After all, the streamer just rolled out Seth Rogen's "The Studio," which has received very positive reviews from viewers and critics alike. And Apple TV+ features select Major League Soccer matches from MLS Season Pass and is the home of "Friday Night Baseball," a weekly Major League Baseball double-header with no local broadcast restrictions. Apple does not clarify what a "qualifying returning subscriber" is, but you can check your eligibility at the Apple TV+ webpage or via the Apple TV app. This offer is set to expire on April 24, 2025. Those who are eligible will get the deal for three months, then the plan will automatically renew at $9.99 per month until canceled. Apple points out that there are a few ineligible parties. Those who are eligible for a free three months can't snag it. Neither can anyone who gets Apple TV+ through a third party or mobile wireless provider.
html:
Whether you're Apple TV+ curious or looking to return after a lapsed subscription, you can now get three months of Apple TV+ for $2.99 a month. Here's how to find out if you qualify, and how to get the deal.

On Tuesday, Apple TV+ announced that it will be offering a promotional deal for new and qualifying returning subscribers. Now you can pay just $2.99 per month for three months to access the catalog of Apple Original series and films.

It's perfect for those who want to get in on the "Severance" hype, as the series is having a bit of a moment right now. A month after "Severance" aired its second season premiere, it toppled "Ted Lasso" as the most watched Apple TV+ series.

Of course, there are plenty of other things to watch on Apple TV+, too. After all, the streamer just rolled out Seth Rogen's "The Studio," which has received very positive reviews from viewers and critics alike.

And Apple TV+ features select Major League Soccer matches from MLS Season Pass and is the home of "Friday Night Baseball," a weekly Major League Baseball double-header with no local broadcast restrictions.

Apple does not clarify what a "qualifying returning subscriber" is, but you can check your eligibility at the Apple TV+ webpage or via the Apple TV app. This offer is set to expire on April 24, 2025.

Those who are eligible will get the deal for three months, then the plan will automatically renew at $9.99 per month until canceled.

Apple points out that there are a few ineligible parties. Those who are eligible for a free three months can't snag it. Neither can anyone who gets Apple TV+ through a third party or mobile wireless provider.
